I guess you have gone through the "Test Infected"
by Erich Gamma,I found it to be the best example of 
Junit usage,also the Starter Guide at diaspar.com is
very good.

--- Amir Michail
<amichail@...> wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I would like to do some research on applications
> that make use
> of junit.  Ideally, such applications would be
> non-trivial yet
> understandable by someone not familiar with the
> domain.  Moreover,
> the application should have lots of test cases with
> meaningful names that 
> exercise much of the functionality of that
> application.
> 
> Any recommendations?  Applications written in Python
> would be good also
> though I suspect there are a lot more written in
> Java.
> 
> Amir
> 
>
